data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3169589,"name":"Elkbits","username":"Elkbits","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/elkbits/{size}/8480_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-21T17:37:36.457Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eHello all! I’m looking for some help in implementing a safety check in our code. We use an XBox controller for our arm position and have several preset positions assigned to the POV hat. My problem is that, when an XBox controller is NOT connected to the drive station, the 0 degree POV position is automatically activated (which is, of course, fully extended and high up).  The code ignores all POV values as long as the POV is -1 (default for the POV). But when an XBox is not attached we get a 0 and not an error… I have tried saving the error status in the Begin after the setref but apparently the joystick open command for a non-connected joystick does not cause an error.   Any ideas?  more than one student and mentor has almost received a robot-uppercut when programming activates the bot.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2023-03-21T17:37:36.457Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":14,"reads":51,"readers_count":50,"score":80.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":431151,"topic_slug":"testing-for-a-joystick-xbox-control-pad-specifically-connection","display_username":"Elkbits","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":25904,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/testing-for-a-joystick-xbox-control-pad-specifically-connection/431151/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3169657,"name":"mshafer1","username":"mshafer1","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/96bed5/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-21T18:38:12.353Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003e1: Never activate when there is someone next to the robot (easiest safety option is to prevent situations that can go wrong).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e2: Maybe read the POV immediately in open and if it is 0, inject an error into the wire (use the merge errors). (although, I’m not sure you’ll get a value when the robot is not enabled).\u003cbr\u003e\nAlternatively, could use a feedback node or similar that tracks if has ever seen a -1. If not. don’t
